page.title: 13FARMING - DEER
page.content:
March. The snow breaks up, the weak deer die. The stags cast their antlers and eat them as they contain valuable minerals. Chemical licks are put out to supplement their diet.
April. Foxes are breeding and are shot as they kill far more than they can eat. The 2 terrier dogs work hard at this time of year. Road mending and bridge repairs after the winter ice and snow must be done. There are 6 miles of road to be maintained from Dalwhinnie to Ben Alder House. The 1,000 acres of trees need their fences repaired as well.
